Australia: South Australia took control of the Northern Territory which was previously part of the colony of New South Wales.
Belgium: State visit of Queen Victoria to Belgium.
Cambodia: Faced with a domestic rebellion, Norodom was forced to accept an offer of protection from the French.
Chile: A French adventurer proclaims himself Orélie Antoine I, King of Araucanía. After a short time he is arrested by the Chileans and deported in the pacification of Araucanía.
Colombia: Foundation of Pereira, Colombia by Remigio Antonio Cañarte
The name of the Republic is changed officially to "United States of Colombia" through the Rionegro Constitution
Tomás Cipriano de Mosquera is the first President of the United States of Colombia
The Flag of Colombia is officially adopted
England: The first underground train went into operation in London.
Germany: The General German Workers' Association was formed.
Japan: Order to expel barbarians, Battle of Shimonoseki Straits, Bombardment of Kagoshima and other events
Malaysia: Rentap's fortress at Nanga Skrang was successfully infiltrated by the attacking party of Tuan Muda Charles Brooke and Rentap ultimately retired from the war.
Philippine: An earthquake leaves Manila in ruins
Andres Bonifacio, founder of the Katipunan, was born.
Russia: January Uprising: An anti-Russian uprising began in Poland; girls allowed into secondary schools and standard curriculum set.
Taiwan: Lin Wencha is promoted to commander-in-chief of Fujian troops, the highest position ever attained by a Taiwanese during the Qing dynasty
USA: Battle of Gettysburg: The battle takes place.
Lincoln issues the Emancipation Proclamation freeing slaves in those states that had seceded.
Siege of Vicksburg: The siege takes place.
New York City draft riots: Draft riots take place.
Pro-Union counties which had seceded from Virginia become the 35th state West Virginia.
